title: Racing Savannah
reviewText: Racing Savannah is the fourth book of the sweet series Hundred Oaks by Miranda Kenneally. I started this series at the beginning of 2013, and enjoyed it a lot. Catching Jordan is my number one favorite in this series, followed by Racing Savannah. This is such a sweet, cute and happy reading. If you’re looking for something light, something to have fun with.. This might be it!Racing Savannah introduces you to Savannah Barrows, a girl who’s been around horses since she was a little girl. Now, she’s moved to Cedar Hill Farms, in Franklin, Tennessee, where she’ll have to start a new life with her dad and his pregnant girlfriend. Oh, and Jack, Jack Goodwin. Owner of the farm (at least for a year). She knows she has to work hard to have a future. A future far away from what she’s known all her life. She doesn’t want to end up like her father, working for a min wage. So, she plans on working at the farm as a horse exercise rider. She knows everything about how to treat and take care of horses. She knows what she wants and she’s going to get it. At least she’ll give herself a chance to try.This is a lovely story. Like I said, my second favorite of the Hundred Oak Series. Miranda Kenneally knows how to write her stories with a great sense of humor and a great amount of “drama”, even though you don’t get it as the typical end-of-the-world drama. So this is a pretty easy reading. I started it yesterday and a couple of hours later I was halfway through it. It’s not just that’s a light reading, it’s how appealing it is for the reader, at least for me it was. It presents a good, strong female main character. Savannah knows what she wants, she wants more for her, her future and her family’s future, and she wants someone who loves her, no secrets, no hiding. Savannah is smart, strong and loving. She cares about her family and her friends. She has a good heart. She’s passionate about what she loves and I just liked her a lot. She’s such a relatable character. She seemed real. We also have a gorgeous male main character, Jack. He’s following his father’s step, even though it may interfere with what or who he wants for himself . He’s sweet and smart, but so scared of disappointing his dad. He’s learning, not just how to run a farm but to let himself care about someone and stand up for himself. I liked him a lot.This book, just like the previous books, shows a world where friends and family are important. Where what you want and need for yourself is as important as what others want for themselves and what they expect from you. It’s a beautiful series, because it encourages the readers to acknowledge how much self-worth matters. That we shouldn’t put everyone’s needs before ours. At least not always. While you’re reading, you get to see how the main character is growing as a person, challenging herself to do things that she never thought she would. And you kind of get to grow a little bit along with the characters.Oh! And I almost forgot... I especially LOVED Parker and Will's appearance. It was awesome and ohh I just loved it :).I love these books. I like how Miranda Kenneally presents a simple story but adds so many things to it, it ends up being a great and lovely book.

title: Kissed by an Angel: Kissed by an Angel; The Power of Love; Soulmates
reviewText: The first 3 books of Kiss By An Angel was I enjoyed it very much, so.. If you're looking for a book with romance, mystery and guardian angels, this is it :).The story was really interesting and different, the romance was the right amount of heartbreaking and lovely, although I thought we could've read a little more of Tristan and Ivy as a couple. The mystery was really good, I had so many theories of what was going on, but then something happened and I had to change my theory (again). So that was fun. There were so many possibilities and the author played them well.The characters were amazing, everyone played their part pretty well so that added a lot to the mystery. There was a good development of the characters. Tristan (I just loved him and felt so bad for him) was the sweetest, you could see how desperately in love he was with Ivy, and I liked her (sometimes, not always), you could feel her sadness and I think that was what made her take some crapy decisions (at least that's what I'm telling myself haha). Oh and I adooooored Phillip.And I can finally say I'm ok with 'the other guy' :) and that is BIG, since I don't usually (and when I say usually I mean NEVER) like the other guy haha

title: Shadow's Dangers (The Last Hope) (Volume 1)
reviewText: Well, well, well, what a nice surprise this was. If you’re a fan of Jennifer Armentrout’s Lux series, you’ll enjoy this book.This is the story of Deliah and how her whole life was changed in a matter of months. Her grandmother recently died, her sister hates her and the nightmares that came around the same time of her grandmother’s death are giving her horrible headaches. Everything gets worse when the Wates come to town, Garreth, Leighton and Travis. Garreth being hot one second and cold the next, and Travis… he’s just down right mean. Leighton, on the other hand was sweet and friendly from the start. Oh, and let’s not forget about the horrible visions Deliah gets every time she crosses gazes with Garreth. Yes, these people are weird, they have deep secrets and all of them seem to lead to Deliah.This book was really, really good. I was hooked from the start. You won’t get to understand everything right away… But you start forming ideas of what’s happening and what are these secrets and monsters really about. I really liked the characters, they were all very, very well presented. Deliah is a shy girl, she doesn’t like attention, mainly because she’s gotten a lot of bad attention thanks to her scandalous sister. But she’s a strong character. She won’t stand anyone treating her badly or anything. Then we have Garreth… Oh I liked him! He first starts being this mean guy.. but as Deliah starts to get to know him… She starts seeing another side of him, a nicer side. A side she starts to like. He has some sweet gestures and he’ll do anything to protect those he loves. Leighton.. She’s a nice strong girl too. She’s the one who knows how to calm the people around her and get everything done right. Travis, well he’s full of surprises, I’ll tell you that.This is a really good story, and like my BBS said, it also reminded me of The Mortal Instruments series, but it was more like the Lux series to me. I loved Garreth and Deliah’s relationship. He’ll do anything to protect her and so will she. He’s sweet to her and you know he loves her. I really hope there’s going to be a second book. There’s no way this story is ending like this.

title: The Rules of Regret
reviewText: I found this book thanks to Colleen Hoover, who recommended it on her facebook page.Rules of regret is a book that talks about how everyone should live and enjoy life, experience it with no regrets. Everyone has problems, some people have it worst than others, but everyone should be able to find peace at some point and move on.I think this book presents two different but equally hard situations. First, you have Darby, who lost her sister when they were both just little kids. She grew up, sure, but didn't live. She had a routine and life, but she wasn't really living. Then you have Torin. He too lost someone really close to him, his brother, but under different circumstances, only he chose to give meaning to his life and his brother's death. I think it makes you think about how life in general, how we react to certain things and people. And to give ourselves (and other people too) second and third chances.The book was good, I liked it, I just didn't love it. The characters were ok, Darby was a bit too dependent for my taste. But I guess I understand why she was that way. She needed stability after losing a big part of her. I think I could relate a bit more with Torin though. I liked him better, he was so full of life, even after everything he'd been through. This book showed me something I think I already knew, but either way, we should always remember. Even after losing someone, people have to find a way to move on. It doesn't mean you have to forget, you just have to move on, live and enjoy life.I think that was what I liked the most, that and the cover, because seriously.. Look at that cover! I just loved it :)

title: Contessa (Choisie) (Volume 1)
reviewText: Contessa is the story of Olivia Sophia Holland. She's Emi' and Jack's daughter. She's a teenager who's starting to see the world through her own eyes and wants to explore more, have more of it, and not by herself of course... There's Jon. Jon Augustus Scott. But there are rules. Contessa is a story of self discovery, growing up and love. But this is also a story that will show you the hard part of being a teenager and how rough relationships between parents and daughters (in this case) can be.My thoughts:First, let me tell you something.. It is no surprise that I loved this story. I mean, it's Lori L. Otto we are talking about. I can't not love her books. That being said, let me tell you what I thought about the story.I thought Contessa was a complicated book to read. Why? Simply because I'm not a teenager anymore and the attitude Olivia had towards some things was just so infuriating. But I guess that's just how kids are these days. I don't remember being that defiant. Just know that this book shows you exactly how kids act, well at least some. It is real. The thoughts, the attitude, the way Olivia saw everything... I thought it was pretty accurate to how a teenager would think and act. Lori's an expert writing real characters and real stories. It's amazing, how they always are just so right.I loved Contessa. This is a wonderful story that goes after the Emi Lost & Found series. Like I said before, this is about self discovery. Olivia is just starting to see the world through her own eyes, experiencing new things with not so new people, this includes Jack, Emi, Donna and Jon. She's exploring new things as an artist too and that's helping her understand her life a little better, to grow up as a person, it just took her a while to see the real meaning of her art.This book has so much love in it. It has a husband's love towards his wife; a wife's love towards her husband; their love towards their children. A boyfriend and a girlfriend's love towards each other. But mostly, a dad's love towards his daughter. And not only a dad's love... It's Jack's love towards Livvy. And that's beautiful, because every time Jack talked to Livvy, I could see and hear in my mind how much he loved her. It was like I was there, I saw Jack's expressions, heard his love for his daughter in every word he said... and I know this might sound insane, but I swear I felt it that way. It was impossible to read this and not feel how in love Jack was with his daughter (and I mean this in a fatherly way, not a creepy one!!!!), but you could see this from the moment he met her.While I was reading Contessa I was constantly frustrated, because Olivia's actions were too childish sometimes... But I also understood why she acted the way she did, after all, she was just a child. Until she realized that she had to take her responsibilities seriously... There's was never going to be any chance for her to be taken as an adult.The book is focus on one relationship in particular. You would think it was Jon's and Olivia's relationship, but to me, it was between Jack and Olivia. There was obviously a huge wall between them, one that Olivia had put there, one that Jack was constantly trying to take down. Their relationship was breaking and breaking with every passing day, because Olivia didn't want to see the beauty in it. So, it was heartbreaking for me to see how hurtful she was sometimes. Let me talk a little about the characters.Olivia.When I fist met her, she was the sweetest thing. Now, she's all grown up and wants to be on her own. Do what she wants, be with whoever she wants. Yes, she's kind of a brat, but she has the biggest heart. She's compassionate, she adores her family, even when she wasn't acting very maturely, I knew she loved them. I loved her relationship with Emi, it was beautiful to see how trusting they both were with each other. Emi was her mom, but she was also her friend. But Emi is like that.Olivia's art is something especial too. That bond she thought she had with Nate, at first I thought it was so amazing, that she could feel the way she did about someone she hadn't met. That she admired him so much. But then, it totally changed. I hated how she made Nate a bad influence, something that would eventually hurt her family so badly. That would hurt Jack and Emi so much.I love Nate, Lori knows this. He's my number one book boyfriend. And I felt so protective about him reading this book, because Livvy was damaging his image before everyone else's eyes (not mine of course). It wasn't fair. And just so we are clear... I know Nate wasn't perfect. I know this. But to me, he's one character that will stick forever with me. I don't agree with whoever thinks he couldn't have been a great father. He would have. He would've done ANYTHING for Emi and his family, if he'd had the chance. He would've made Emi happy. He would've have grown up, done things differently. I know it. Yes, she's one of the 3 characters with whom I've thought was possible to have two loves. BUT I do think Jack was, is and will always be the perfect father for Olivia.Jack has such an important role in this book and Olivia's life. He's always been so supportive of her and I hated she couldn't see that. She couldn't see past the fact that he was "too protective". I guess, he kind of was, but I guess he has a lot of reasons to be. I loved Jack a lot more in this book. I saw some of his flaws, something that I didn't see in TSS or NLB. This book made him a lot more real to me. And I loved how he loved Olivia, even after everything she had said... But I guess that swap hat fathers do.Jon.Jon. Jon. Jon. Well, he is something. He's mature, he's passionate about the people and things he loves. He's ambitious, respectful, honorable. But he's also kind of bad. Not bad for Livvy, but like... He's defiant. He wanted to show her everything, and at first, I did think they were going too fast. Something that he'll realize later. I loved him. How sweet he was with Livvy. How he'd stand up to Jack and anyone for that matter, to defend Livvy. He loves her, that much is clear. And he knows what he wants and what he needs. When he thought they needed space, he said it. He was honest and I loved that about him.Oh and Donna? That lady is just too much. She's an amazing granna. I loved that she loved Olivia just as if she were her granddaughter for real. She's too loving, she cares a lot about people, especially those around her. I loved her from the very start.This book is just another reason of why I love Lori.

title: Olivia (Choisie) (Volume 2)
reviewText: Again, another wonderful book by Lori L. Otto. You just can't not love her books and her characters.First of all, I want to say thank you to Lori for giving me the chance to read and ARC of this amazing book. <3 I loved it and I can't wait to read the next one.In book 1, you meet Contessa, Jack Holland's little girl, only she's not a little girl anymore. She's starting to grow up, to see the world through her own eyes and like I've said before, she wants it all, even if it means she has to lie and sneak around to get it. But this second book is another story.Olivia's life has had a lot of ups and downs since she was little, but still, she's managed to learn how to deal with those situations, sometimes making a lot of mistakes, but at the end she's done what she knows is right. There's more maturity in her and she tries to be as honest as she can, which is something I liked a lot. She's still the innocent little girl, but with more confidence.I don't know if I'm the only one who felt this way about the book, but I still don't feel like it was just a love story. Like in book 1, in which I felt it was the story of the struggle and reconciliation between a father and his daughter, to me, Olivia is the story of growing up. Of accepting accepting and being exactly who you are, no matter how the people around you see you or want you to be. She now has to deal with two great loss, two things she loved more than anything in her life. So she starts to focus all her attention in that other thing she loves, Jon. It was her way of dealing and what she thought would help her heal, because he kept her distracted and she needed that.Through the whole book I felt her struggle, how frustrated she was because she couldn't go back to the way she was before, some moments were more noticeable than others, and even though Jon made her completely happy, there was always something missing.Well, first I'd like to say that in this story you see the way the characters grow. I'm the youngest to the oldest, they've all learned different life lessons that made them a lot more patient a lovable and real. The story line is a lot more capturing, not that Contessa wasn't, but this one allows you to relate more and more to with the main characters.So, what did I think about Olivia this time? Well, she obviously grew up a lot since book 1. She's the same girl but with another perspective on life. She now knows, no doubt, how much her dad loves her, how much she means to him and her entire family. She's more confident about herself as a person and deep down, as an artist too. The only thing is, she became too dependent on Jon and their relationship, which kind of frustrated me. I feel she needs to be on her own a little, get to know herself a little bit better and experience life from her own perspective. And I think she'll get her time.I like Jon, I really do but, even though Livvy denied he was the reason and even though I KNOW Jon would never do that on purpose, I felt he was kind of holding her back. They both need time.I can't wait to read next book. I'm sure it will be as beautiful as all her books.<3

title: The Book of Life: A Novel (All Souls Trilogy)
reviewText: In this final conclusion of All Souls trilogy, Diana and Matthew return to the present time. In Sept-Tours they reunite with their family and together they’ll face the threat of danger and search for the missing last pages of Ashmole 782.It’s always a sob-fest to see one of your favorite series come to an end. I’ve read A Discovery of Witches and Shadow of Night countless of times, I can quote it with my eyes closed, but really don’t take my word for it. These books changed my life and they will always have a very special place in my heart. No matter how many times I’ve read this particular scenes, I will always shed a tear. I’m peculiar like that. This isn’t an easy road for every reader out there who becomes so attached with these precious characters.All Souls Trilogy is a widely popular series. While some people think it’s tedious and rather boring, I have always found it fascinating and it intrigued me to no end with it’s rich world building. The Book of Life, like its predecessors, is a work of art, a true master piece. It’s no surprise that it’s profoundly and gallantly written. Harkness explores the usual concept and themes of her books. The plausible steamy romance, plenty of fun historical input, magic and paranormal.We also get to meet some of the old characters who are returning in the present times like Gallowglass and the other members of De Clermont family. That was such a fun part! I couldn’t help but crave more back story and while there are some twists that I didn’t anticipate coming, The Book of Life ended neatly. It went where I always thought it would go.Deborah Harkness spellbinds her readers with the stunning conclusion of All Souls Trilogy, The Book of Life.

title: The Ring and the Crown
reviewText: I am such a sucker for Historical Fiction & Fantasy. It is my greatest weaknesses. de la Cruz and I have a pretty long history back then, Blue Bloods are one of the first vampire series that I’ve ever read and It follows up with Witches of East End which I wholeheartedly enjoy, book and tv-series wise!The Ring and The Crown have a large group of main characters. It follow the story of four girls and two princes. Marie-Victoria, the quiet gentle princess who is set to marry the crown prince of Prussia, Leopold. She has a best friend Aelwyn who is a sorceresses who one day will be the Queen’s Mage. Ronan Astor, a young American beauty who is determined to make a good match to save her family’s reputation. Isabelle of Orleans, the cast aside ‘true love’ of Leopold. ‘Wolf’, the dangerous wild younger brother of the prince.It is a usual arrangement for Fantasy and Historical Fiction books to have an alternating point of views with their bunch set of characters, sometimes it can get a little bit messy and confusing but somehow it works perfectly fine for The Ring and The Crown.Here are the few things that I did really enjoy and didn't liked about the book.WHAT I LIKED.• The world building is not perfect but it is stunning and glamorous. There are mouthful of titles and terms that thankfully isn't too confusing for my case.• Romance, the book have a lot of romance. Ronan and Wolf might be my favorite. There’s so many swoon alert there.• Four different female characters who have their own definition of the word ‘strong heroine’, yes as expected they have to worry about their fancy dresses, hair and their magic but they also have more pressing problems to face other than romance, that is simply awe-inspiring.WHAT I DIDN'T LIKED.• Plot Twists, by the last 30% of the book there are a lot of bombs dropping every now and then. That was overwhelming and too anticlimactic for me.• Emotional Development, I hope this department was polished and developed even more.• Some of the scenes of the book, I actually had seen it coming.Over all The Ring & The Crown is a fast paced book that will enticed you with it’s glamorous world. I wouldn't mind reading more books about this world.Review also posted at Young Adult Hollywood.

title: The Unbound (An Archived Novel) (The Archived)
reviewText: It’s one of those days that I wish my review would write itself and I hope it would do justice in describing how brilliant The Unbound is. You have no idea how I nearly cried when I got the approval to read the E-arc of The Unbound. I could have sworn the angels were weeping with me.The Unbound follows up where The Archived left off, as Mac starts her junior year at Hyde School. She’s struggling, trying to get her normal life back, but moving on isn’t easy when someone is haunting you, even in your waking hours. And then people are starting to vanish without a trace and the only thing they have in common is Mackenzie. She becomes the prime suspect, and unless Mac can track the real culprit, she’ll lose everything: her role as Keeper, her memories, and even her life.Immediately, I was thrust back into Mac’s world. The Unbound’s plot flows smoothly, I didn’t have any qualms getting into it. It was perfect. The world building is completely visually stunning. It’s as real as it gets, I felt like I was really walking in Narrows.I loved every single character in this book, though I’m not exactly fond of Agatha and Owen (that’s a complete different matter we shouldn’t event *shhhhush* speak about). I adored Mac, she’s one of my favorite protagonists and heroines. I can understand where she’s coming from, her story and pain are relatable. Half of the book was basically about how her walls are starting to crack and she doesn’t know how to pull herself back together, mentally and emotionally speaking. Wesley Ayers is one of the many reasons why I love this series, aside from the fact that he’s a drool-worthy kind of fictional character. He’s charming, smart and he genuinely care about Mac. Seriously, you will swoon. I certainly wouldn’t mind reading a book or e-novella in his point of view. Just Saying. All of the sideline characters are fully fleshed out just like the main characters. It’s nice to see new fresh faces. They heightened the book’s humor even more. The romance is well built. Mac and Wesley are as great together as they are individually. I can remarkably recall making this dying noise every time they have a scene together.And, of course, it isn’t Schwab’s book if it doesn’t make you feel like you’re already in heaven and the next thing you know, you’re lying on the cold hard ground, bleeding in pain. It’s okay, I forgive you, Victoria. I know you love to feed off your reader’s pain. It makes you healthy.I couldn’t express enough how brilliant The Unbound is. I didn’t put this book down till I was done. Victoria Schwab has that gift. She writes everything so beautifully. The Unbound surpassed every bit of my standards. A great follow up to an incredible series.

recommend_top_items: ['Sweet Filthy Boy (Wild Seasons)', 'Raw', 'Taut: The Ford Book (a Rook and Ronin Spinoff)', 'Forever With You (Fixed) (Volume 3)', 'NaN', 'NaN', 'Tainted: Torn Series #3 (The Torn Series) (Vol...', 'Lovers at Heart (Love in Bloom: The Bradens, B...', 'NaN', 'Wrecked']
reviewText: There’s a puffy, bloodshot-eyed zombie roaming around our house, thrashing, crying and screaming I’m not okay. She’s a new breed created by the epidemic Hothouse Flower.I’ve been waiting for this book since forever. I went in expecting something fluffy and a little bit of crying, but I was wrong. Hothouse Flower is told from alternating points of view of Ryke and Daisy. I shipped them from the very start. They both stole my heart in Ricochet.  They’re going to melt your heart, make it all gooey, and probably make you bawl in their own book.We all know why the equation R + D can’t ever happen. He’s twenty five. She’s finally eighteen. But that doesn’t sound as easy as it looks. Ryke knew Daisy when she was 15, 16, 17, and, aside from their ‘problematic’ age gap, there are a lot of roadblocks and hindrances they need to overcome, like a disapproving mom, a not-so-pleased brother, the media, lots of family drama & their own inner demons.I’ve never been so in love with a book and characters before that I constantly feel like my heart is going to burst out of my chest. Yes! I’m talking about Hothouse Flower and the Addicted Series. Krista and Becca never fail to remind me why they’re one of my favorite pairs of authors and why I read books. It’s very difficult for me to articulate my feelings and put them into words. All I can say is that it hit me harder than I thought it would. Hothouse Flower is raw and painful. It left me with undeniable ache.Every single thing and element about this book is fully fleshed out and it’s something I highly praise. Like always, the characters are drawn brilliantly. They’re deep, complex and real. Probably one of the most beautiful sets of characters I’ve ever encountered. The romance is perfect. It’s everything I had hoped for and wanted. I could see it coming who would initiate the relationship. (Hah!) I’m sorry I just had to bring that up. It’s my badass I-told-you-so moment. Other than the 1, 2 ,3 ,4, 5, 6 common things that I’ve anticipated. The rest is holy cow unpredictable. A lot of times, I find myself wanting to bury myself alive because I cannot believe that just happened. Wait. What. What. It can’t. Exactly, that’s the picture.Aside from the romance, what I love the most in the book is the emotional impact of the media, family ordeal/drama and how their parents and upbringing affected them. For me the astonishing aspect of this novel is that our loved ones make mistakes, they make bad calls. No reasons can ever justify those. It will affect us, It will destroy us. But it’s our decision if we’re going to let it haunt us forever. Its deeply emotional read for me that has had me all choked up. It’s amazing because these things do happened in real life. We lived in this story. One way or another this book has something that will touch your heart.In each chapter, all of the emotions are heightened and are always tangible. Hothouse Flower is about guilt, pain, misery, grief, forgiveness, discovering yourself, the power of friendship, family, relationship and, most importantly, love.Reading Krista and Becca’s books once is simply not enough. You’ll go back to it every day and if not, every once in a while, just like home. After all of the heart-break I went through with Hothouse Flower, I couldn’t be anymore happy how it all turns out. This is easily one of the best and most heart wrenching book I’ve ever read to date.

title: Kiss the Sky
reviewText: If you know me, you could definitely say I live a Addicted Series appreciation life so please bear with me as I lamely articulate my feelings and thoughts about Kiss the Sky.When I picked up Addicted to You, I had never anticipated it would easily become one of my favorite series ever. Reading this amazing books was like stepping out of my comfort zone. It’s a completely alien thing for me. And it’s a great feeling. I can’t never get enough of it. I had never fathom that this could be my thing until it just suddenly happened. It knocked me off my feet. Hands down to this incredible series.Kiss the Sky is a stand-alone and spin-off book from Addicted Series and are told from Rose Calloway and Connor Cobalt point of view. Like Becca said in their blog post Kiss the Sky is a little bit different than Lily and Lo’s books and that’s not a bad thing. It’s like a breather from the pure rawness of its predecessors. I’m not saying it’s not going to be as painful as the others but kind of moderate but not really. In Addicted Series Connor is that guy who tutored Lily who happened to be Rose’s number one academic rival back then. We’ve watched their story unravel through the eyes of Lily and Lo but Kiss the Sky is the real deal. In this book we will see how will Rose and Connor will deal with their inner demons in their own Point of View.I always say this every time I read a alternate pov that are told from female and male point of view. I hate reading male point of view. Sometimes they sound obnoxious I couldn’t properly connect with the character but I guess it depends on the author. The writing is on point as always. I have no complains or what so ever. Hands down. Becca and Krista did a fantastic job. The plot flow smoothly. The spacing was just right. The Reality TV part was actually so fun to read. It was a rollercoaster ride of crazy, fun, steamy scenes and tension. Seriously just perfect.Connor and Rose are one of the most fascinating couple and characters I’ve ever come across. They’re the most self assured people in the world in the sense if you throw a bomb at their feet, they exactly know how they are going to fix it, Sherlock style. Kiss the Sky perfectly captured how will they both come undone as they handled all of the obstacles they have to face. I empathize and can relate to Rose so much (as the rest of the characters). She’s a very empowering woman. I was at the edge of my seat as I watched her struggled to not caved in at her desires. Her needs to be in control are one of the many things, I love about her! It’s a very rare thing to see in New Adult for a female character not to let a manhandle her. I adored that. I admit I underestimated Connor and never properly gave him enough credit. Kiss the Sky opened up my eyes. He’s a very complex character and I think this book perfectly showed his depth. He is amazing. I have a new found love and respect for Connor, It was very evident now. Connor and Rose character development and relationship progress was very apparent. The way that Connor put Rose welfare before his own and Rose clearing her schedule for Connor makes me want to cry. All of this little things showed how this characters changed so much. It was powerful, unlike any other romances. Swoon just swoon.You don’t know the exact definition of crazy and insane till you’ve read Kiss the Sky. I had never anticipated half of the things that Rose and Connor did in this book. They are everything I didn't expect them to be. Hey! genius can be crazy too. Their relationship cracks me up every time. I ship it! It was very comical in all honesty. The humor of Kiss The Sky is insanely funny. IT IS FLAWLESS. I need to paused every five seconds because of the ridiculous banter. I don’t know how Becca and Krista managed to do it after 3 books. I think they never ran out jokes that will make you cry for a minute or two.OH GOD OH GOD I CANT BREATHE. I COULDN’T PROPERLY ARTICULATE MY WORDS. I HAVE TOO MANY FEELINGS. Lily and Lo would always have a special place in my heart. They are such a cute little pie geeks. If you don’t ship them, you cannot sit with us. That's the rule here.Ryke and Daisy.Ryke Daisy are my babies. Their chemistry was like woah over the top. It’s all over the place. I was sold.I can say Ryke, Lo, Lily & Daisy are integral part of the series. One of the many greatest things about Kiss the Sky was Becca & Krista heightened the family bond and relationship of the characters. Like Rose main priority was wanting to take care of Lily and Daisy more than anything in the world, the cute affectionate animosity of Ryke and Connor, Lo and Rose. Connor, Loren & Ryke Bromance. Sisters love. I couldn’t emphasize enough how much I love it and I couldn’t have it on another way.Kiss the Sky reduced me to tears handful of times and it took me by surprised by its unexpected plot twists. It astound me how this series messed up with my emotions so many times. Basically this book solidify my growing love for this series. I can talk about this books and characters forever and I don’t think so anyone wanted that. Am I right? I’m a self proclaimed fan of Addicted Series and this amazing authors. Kiss the Sky surpassed ever bit of my expectation. I couldn't ask for anything better except more and probably more. It’s a book you wouldn't want to put down.

title: Mystic City (Mystic City Trilogy)
reviewText: Review also posted at Young Adult HollywoodMystic City is a futuristic fantasy book. It follows the story of Aria Rose who doesn’t have any recollection of falling in love with her betrothed Thomas Foster, the son of their family’s sworn enemy. Their marriage will reunite the two families and end the generation feud of their clan. While Aria fills the gaps of her “missing memories”, she meets the rebel mystic Hunter from Depths.I’ve rated Mystic City 3.8 Stars which means I enjoyed it thoroughly and it would’ve been a 4 star read.This book started out strong. I love the politic intrigue and power struggle of the characters. It’s not overdone but just right.The romance is great though it becomes somewhat cheesy in the last 30% of the book.There’s a magical ‘mystic’ aspect in the plot. It’s interesting.The story is predictable.My only problem is the story dragged in the middle part of the story. What a shame. It become anticlimactic.My final verdict: Mystic City is a book I wouldn’t put on my favorite shelf but still it’s an enjoyable and fascinating read.

reviewText: Actual Rating4.5 StarsImaginary Lines is by far my favorite installment from New York Leopards. It follows the story of Tamar who has been in love with linebacker Abe since forever. She’d always considered them as soul-mates till she professed her feelings and Abe rejected her. It’s something she never forgot! Now years later Tamar landed a great opportunity to work for one of New York’s infamous athletic websites. And just as Tamar decided to move on, Abe finally realized she’s the only woman for him.I finished Imaginary Lies in one sitting and I’ve read it a couple of times and the outcome is always the same. I love it more each time. What attracts me to this book is the concept of old childhood friends turned into lovers, which is the #1 fan service an author could ever do for me. There’s also a great deal of feminism points for Tamar. And like the previous installments, the New York Leopards cast made appearances. It was so fun reading and seeing them again. There was never a dull moment!Overall Imaginary Lies is sweet and enjoyable. A highly recommendable read. I can’t wait to read more.

reviewText: I’m always on the prowl to find decent New Adult books. I call myself a fair person, I don’t get annoyed easily and I have patience for cliche things and Dearest Clementine is not just decent, it’s outstanding.Dearest Clementine follow the story of Clementine Avery, who accidentally signs up for a romance writing class and is in dire need of sexy material for her assignment. Then she meets the RA, Gavin Murphy, who is more happy to help her find some inspiration.Clementine is a vibrant protagonist. She’s not difficult to love. It doesn’t hurt that she’s relatable, smart and feisty. She knows how to keep the reader engaged in the story! She also has the best comebacks.One of my favorite things about Dearest Clementine is Gavin and Clem’s funny banter. They are so sweet and did I already mentioned funny?“No, give me half an hour. I just ran and need to take a shower.” “See, that’s too much information. All your book boyfriend is going to do is fantasize about that for the next thirty minutes. That and those little black shorts.”Aside from that I also love and adore the protagonist relationship with her “girlfriends”.“Can I offer my unsolicited opinion?” I mumble into my pillow. “Will you stop talking if I say no?” “Probably not.”Dearest Clementine is not all fluffy and flirty, y e s, there’s a handful of steamy moments which is exactly just my taste. Lex Martin sure knows how to keep it going.As Gavin and Clementine grow closer they unravel some secrets about a missing student at Boston University and conflicts started to ensue in their relationship. While it doesn’t take a genius to discover the culprit, I immensely enjoyed the “mystery” element. Hands down to Lex Martin for using the “being stalked by professor” because this kind of story does really happen in real life and though some of the tropes in the story are the common twist in New Adult books nowadays, I still find it more neatly done.I already expressed how uncomfortable I am with the term of endearment used by Clementine and her friends. It’s one of my reading pet peeves. They say it in an affectionate and endearing way though and I understand that real life people also do this and that doesn’t stop me from enjoying a great book. Overall Dearest Clementine is a fantastic debut. It will certainly join my favorite “New Adult” shelf.

title: Trust in Me: A Novel (Wait for You)
reviewText: Actual rating: 3.8 StarsI recently binge read the first three books in the Wait For You series and It was even better than what I was expecting and Trust in Me is my favorite installment yet.I didn’t like Wait for You that much and I was wary that this full length novella would be just about Cam’s perspective on something I’ve already read about in book one. title: The Immortal Crown: An Age of X Novel
reviewText: Review also posted at Young Adult Hollywood.Actual Rating: 3. 5 StarsImmortal Crown is the sequel to Richelle Mead's Adult Scifi series, Gameboard of the Gods. On this follow up story, Mae Koskinen and Justin Marc are both busy doing a classified investigation in and out of RUNA and to add more conflict to the story, some of the humans that are marked by divine also called elects are turning one another. On their next mission Lucian Darling and his delegation along with Justin and Mae are headed to Arcadia, their neighbor country. In this society women are treated as "hot commodity" and their religion have a massive impact and influence on their government.It is well established that I am a massive Richelle Mead fan. Almost everything she wrote, I completely devoured. Gameboard of the Gods is an outstanding book. I love every bits of it and that is so rich coming from someone who avoids the Sci-fi and Dsytopian section in bookstores. Immortal Crown is one of my highly anticipated books of 2014, with a heavy heart I'm going to tell you this book is disappointing. It sadly falls to the Sequel Syndrome. I would have never seen it coming from Richelle Mead since Frostbite, The Golden Lily are brilliant sequels that solidify my love for her series. Immortal Crown is more of an Succubus on Top hit or miss for me. It’s not engaging as it’s predecessor but the great thing about Georgina Kincaid is it got better after each book. I hope this will also be the case for Age of X series.Immortal Crown started out in a dull note, I reassured myself it would pick up eventually. But no no no. Mead's mojo didn't worked out this time. The terms was hard to grasp. I was tiptoeing for the half of the book, thankfully Mead's usual recapping helped me somehow in refreshing my mind on what happened in the first book & understanding some of the points I can't wrap my mind with.The misogynistic views of the Arcadian netizens, It was disgusting and twisted. It enrages me. It will definitely emit aggressive response from readers.The characters undergo on a little character development though I still believe their story arc should've gotten a pretty great thorough leap by now.The twist of the story are completely unnecessary. The pent up sexual tension between Mae and Justin went overboard in the last 30% of the book.Immortal Crown isn't the book I was hoping but I did really like it. It's not a terrible book in a long shot but I wish there are many things that could've furnish. Hopefully this will be a series that continue to get better in each installment.

title: Cress (Lunar Chronicles)
reviewText: I’m not a fan of Scarlet in the second book of this series that sadly falls to my sequel syndrome. It just didn’t emit any aggressive addicting feelings I felt while reading Cinder but I’m terribly glad I gave this series another chance. Cress captured my rapt attention from the very first chapter. I don’t know how to put my love for this book into words.The third installment of The Lunar Chronicles follows the story of Cress, who is currently imprisoned on a satellite since childhood. She’s awkward and comfortable in spending her days with the company of her netscreens, with that knowledge she’s a marvelous hacker. She receives an order from Queen Levana to track down Cinder and Thorne. When the group daringly rescue Cress, things don’t go as planned and the group gets separated.One of the many fantastic things about The Lunar Chronicles is that even though it’s a retelling of well known fairy tales we grew up to and we fondly love, they are refreshing, totally different and there’s always something new to offer with surprising twists.Hands down to Marissa Meyers for writing a great set of fascinating, diverse characters and heroines. Cress certainly lives up to the hype. I couldn’t wait to get lost in this final installment of the series.

reviewText: I won’t lie..the beautiful cover had me clicking the request button. It’s so pretty, beautiful and eye catching to be exact but like most books, a shinny cover doesn’t always mean the book itself will be dazzling but This Is Now did not disappoint!This is Now follows the story of Jess who aspires to study at university despite her dysfunctional family belief that she shouldn’t expect more because of her social status. Then she meets Sebastien, a gifted cellist, who is completely from a different clique. He’s perfect and talented and has great faith in Jess despite all of the frightening secrets she’s keeping. She’s starting to let her wall down but as she tries to carve a path for herself, all her secrets are starting to catch up with her.This is Now started as flat out raw and with no censor. I connected with Jess, the protagonist, immediately. I like the way she narrates and perceives things. WARNING: There were some instances where I wanted to shake her because I really think she can make better life choices. Despite my love/hate tension with her, she improves nonetheless. I liked her though initially I was overwhelmed by how much she worshiped gushed about Sebastien’s godly structural face. If I were in her shoes I probably would have also but seriously I don’t want the whole novel to be all about Sebastien’s face because we got that covered in the first 30% of the book. Thank God those fleeting moments passed. Sebastien is a great male pair for Jess. They are so different yet they fit together perfectly. Seriously guys, swoon. YOU WILL SWOON. The secondary characters are fully fleshed out as much as the main characters. I wouldn’t mind reading books about them also.I liked the plot of the book. It’s not an unusual one but it was well written. The plot flow smoothly and is pretty much a coming-of-age based concept. I appreciated how the book served a great moral lesson in that no matter where you came from, you can still make a different life for yourself. Maggie Gilbert wrote the romance beautifully. It was believable although the ending is quite cheesy. They are so cute and their relationship is one of the many things I adored about the book! This is Now is not a perfect novel as there are some things I wish were better developed but I highly recommend it to everyone who wants a great easy read that has a great moral lesson for readers.

title: The Boleyn Reckoning: A Novel (The Boleyn Trilogy)
reviewText: Review also posted at Young Adult Hollywood.I started this series knowing how some of the things will end but that still didn’t give me any free passes not to cry. I’ve read The Boleyn Reckoning last March and I can still perfectly remember every single thing that I felt while reading this book. It certainly involved ugly sobbing and thrashing till 3AM. I think I will always have this heavy feeling on my stomach and chest that will never go away every time I think of this book. It’s sorrow having to say goodbye to one of my favorite trilogies and to these dear characters. I couldn’t get enough of that to the point I’ve read it more than 2 times. I am morbid, I need to remind myself every once in a while that masterpieces like this exist.There are plenty of reasons why The Boleyn Trilogy is one of my favorite book series ever and why YOU SHOULD READ IT. I am not lying through my teeth when I tell you this is absolutely the most brilliant Historical Fiction – Alternate History books out there.The Boleyn Reckoning quickly follows up where the previous book left off: Minuette and Dominic have to face the consequences of their secret marriage. As England prepares themselves for the threat of invasion, William finally discovers the truth. It’s an act of betrayal that will put Dominic and Minuette’s lives in danger. William’s need for vengeance might push England to the brink of civil war like it was always written in the stars. Elizabeth must choose her brother, or her country?Sometimes when you read an Alternate History book, it just doesn’t fit with your taste and expectation. It flops. The great thing about Laura Andersen is she has this wonderful gift: she perfectly throws the readers into History that somewhat already happened and she’ll wiggle her fingers TA-DA! creating an even more perfect fiction than reality. Her books are always written so vividly and with supplemental details that really brought the whole plot to life. The Boleyn Reckoning is well paced, all of the characters are interesting and well developed.In fear of spoiling the book to everyone, I’ll keep this review neat and short.As much as I hate to say goodbye to this trilogy, The Boleyn Reckoning is engrossing, unflinchingly brutal. It will take you at the edge of your seat. It ended neatly and bittersweet.

title: The Kiss of Deception (The Remnant Chronicles)
reviewText: Review also posted at Young Adult Hollywood.Everybody knows that I inhale High Fantasy books for a living. This is my #1 weakness.Kiss of Deception, I had such a great faith on you. All of my favorite bloggers are running around screaming “this book is epic and brilliant” while I sulk in the corner sighing “definitely not for me.”The writing of this book is good and decent. I’ve got no complaints. Kiss of Deception started out in a dry note and nothing enticed me till three chapters later. What wore me out is the plot, even though I think it’s not a bad one. It’s still an emotional exhausting run for readers like me who don’t have enough patience to skim and see if this book will eventually get better or will it get stuck in that “the main characters are still trying to figure out the plot twist”.I find myself having a neutral reaction toward the characters. They sadly didn’t grow on me. By reading the summary you would have the sensation that, of course, there will be love triangle in the romance of the story. I don’t frown upon this predicament as long as the author knows what she’s doing. But the love triangle weighed down the whole book for me.Even though I had problems with Kiss of Deception, I still think a lot of readers would enjoy this high fantasy book.

title: Free to Fall
reviewText: Review also posted at Young Adult Hollywood.Free to Fall is my first Lauren Miller book and I honestly didn’t have any idea what to expect. The first forty pages were rough for me but once I get through those I was sold and I just fell in love with Miller’s intelligent novel.“What if there was an app that told you what song to listen to, what coffee to order, who to date, even what to do with your life—an app that could ensure your complete and utter happiness? What if you never had to fail or make a wrong choice?What if you never had to fall?”Free to Fall follows the story of Rory Vaughn who is pretty much content living her life following what her Lux app recommends. When she’s accepted to the prestigious boarding school Theden Academy, her future seems to be even more certain. However, once she settles into her dream school she unravels some secrets that will lead her to question Lux’s credibility and everything might not be as it seems.Free to Fall has a very interesting premise that hasn’t been done before. It’s refreshing and realistic. We are so dependent on Wi-Fi, internet, phone, laptop and other gadgets. I can see this book happening in real life, years from now. One of the great things I adore about the book is you can easily get lost with the story despite the fact it’s set in the future.The main message of the book itself is terrifying as it seems youalways have a choice. That’s so simple yet beautiful and powerful. Free to Fall is a great portrayal of fierce protagonist and women, fantastic lady friendship, swoon-worthy guy, and cute romance. Free to Fall is a combination of serious business technology talks with a fluffy and swoon worthy romance scenes. Don’t worry as it doesn’t take over the plot. It’s just right.Free to Fall is very well written. Miller delivers a perfect intricate plot that will make your head spin with it’s interesting convoluted technology talk. Everything is just grand and has a purpose. While some scenes are predictable, I believe there are still twists that you won’t see coming.Free to Fall is a brilliant sci-fi read. Highly recommended to anyone who enjoys reading a book.

title: Ruin and Rising (Grisha Trilogy (Shadow and Bone))
reviewText: Review also posted at Young Adult Hollywood.Ruin and Rising is simply magical and riveting. It has been weeks and I'm still speechless.Ruin and Rising picks up right after where Siege and Storm left it off. The Darkling is ruling Ravka while Alina and her people who worship her as a saint, sun summoner are hiding underground with the help of the oddly suspicious Apparat but her mind is set somewhere else like finding out if Nikolai Lantsov is still alive and hunting the last Morozova's amplifier, the firebird.This conclusion of The Grisha Trilogy received such a heated response. You either love or hate it. There's no middle ground.Ruin and Rising is not in the same caliber as Shadow and Bone & Siege and Storm. It's nowhere near fluff. It is brutal and unflinchingly cruel. It didn't evoked warm, fuzzy and giggly feelings from me, Sure I felt that in some particular scenes but not as strongly as its predecessors.Like expected from Bardugo, her writing is bloody stellar. Readers will easily get back to the story with Ravka's lush setting and the character's wit. There's the usual humor of Bardugo's story every now and then. Those scenes will never get old. One way or another everyone can easily identify with this bunch of flawed characters.Honestly this is how I always imagined the ending would be. I leaned for that because I knew it's going to happen. I'm not pleasantly surprised anymore but my heart doesn't want to say goodbye yet. There will always be this heavy feeling.Some people might disagree but The Grisha Trilogy's ending is groundbreaking. It's message is simply beautiful. (view spoiler) It's about a girl who gave up a crown, an enormous power, her childhood, home and her everything to saved her nation, that pain and sorrow isn't the end. Time doesn't heal anything maybe it just lessen the pain and what truly remain is love and that you'll always find your way back home. Being ordinary and leading an ordinary life with the people you love is sometimes the most extraordinary thing in the world.This kind of story will stay within me forever. Ruin and Rising will certainly leave it's readers breathless, heartbroken somewhere satisfied and yet always begging for more.

title: Seraphina
reviewText: Read on 2013.I love fantasy books and I supposed it’s not a secret to everyone it’s my Achilles heels. Seraphina are probably one of the most hype book ever, It’s on my bucket list since forever and when I finally grabbed the chance to read it I’m nothing but nerves. I was so excited to dived into this world and see if the fuzz are all worth it.Seraphina started out as slow, It was perfectly fine with me thinking it would actually got better as the story unravels. There’s occasional hilarious and witty moments that make up for the rather bland part. As I read further I found something that doesn’t sit well with me and I guess you could say it bothers me up for quite a bit. I’ve read handful of fantasy books set in medieval periods and I didn’t had any rough time connecting with the story and especially with the dialogue. I don’t know if it was only me but the dialogue, pleasantries and some of the terms the author used was really confusing and hard to grasp. The characters were all fine but poorly developed for example [Spoiler Alert] Seraphina had talked to Lucian for several times then they had a quarrel about fraternizing with dragons and the next thing I know Seraphina was crying in a bathroom stall because she realized she loved Lucian. I don’t know about you but that doesn’t really make me giddy. It came out of nowhere. It was poorly developed. Seraphina is a nice heroine. I don’t have any problems with her except I didn’t fell madly in love with her. I’m weird like that.I never thought I would ever say this but Seraphina is a disappointing read. I expected much better from this book.

title: Eleanor & Park (Ira Children's Book Awards. Young Adult)
reviewText: Eleanor and Park are one of 2013 widely popular book. It was impossible for me to ignored it. I honestly couldn’t make out how to rate it yet. I liked it just fine. I didn’t form a bond with it unlike some books with the same theme like Heart on a Chain (though this book is totally different in so many ways because the author managed to elaborate the protagonist family history such as abused, emotional blackmail and what stemmed that action etcetera some things this book failed to explained but that’s a tale for another day.) I originally gave it four stars but as I more pondered about it,I enjoyed Eleanor and Park just fine but not enough to give it four stars.This book is told from Eleanor and Park point of view. According to the book synopsis they are two star-crossed misfits which can be misleading for Park’s part because yeah he encountered brief confusion throughout the novel whether he’s Chinese or that stupid asian kid but he fit in just fine. He’s hardly an outcast unlike Eleanor who is the school pariah because she’s weird and she’s odd for everybody’s standard. The narration is told from Eleanor & Park point of view. It’s back and forth, thankfully it’s not as confusing as it looks though it bothered me that some of the chapters were too short for my taste. It come off as sloppy attempt at writing dual point of view. I didn’t know they still do that anymore till now."Was it possible to rape somebody's hand?"When I've read this part, I gasped out loud. I did tried my best to understand it was told from Park’s perspective who’s a 16 years old boy but you should’ve known better than to lightly used that word, it’s not a good enough reason. This matter should be addressed properly because I saw a lot of people quoting this statement and romanticizing it. It doesn't sit down well with me. Rape is not an adjective word you should use lightly, just because you feel liked it. I’m sure the author meant well and she probably doesn't realized how problematic the connotation of that quote. I just hope she could’ve used a far better word that could perfectly described how Park felt that time though there are no more retracting, what is done is done. End of Rant.God forgive me but I gauged my eyes out and barfed when Park’s dad let his sixteen years old kid who just got his license recently, drive her girlfriend to Minnesota, he even gave his son a money! Why didn’t Park’s dad thought of driving the teenagers to their destination? WHYYYYYYYY. WHYYYYYYYY. WHYYYYYYYY. Fun Fact: I’m nineteen years old and my parents still doesn’t trust me to drive a car by myself. Mainly because the road is a very dangerous place to be. I can’t even fathom the road and drivers back in 1986. It is very unrealistic scenario for me.I enjoyed the romance though sometimes it can be cheesy. Eleanor and Park ended in an abrupt manner in the way I was really unsatisfied how this book ended. There’s no formal closure. Eleanor and Park is a book of contradiction for me. Clearly It’s not a horrible book since it received countless of rave reviews. There was so much buzz and hype about Eleanor and Park, I had such a high expectation about this book. I was anticipating crying my hearts out afterwards, suffering a post depression but It didn't left me with anything except to feel like there’s something missing.

title: Dirty Angels
reviewText: 5 DIRTY DELICIOUS STARS!This is one of my most anticipated releases of the year, Katrina Halle did not disappoint.My review will be short, I have too many things to say that will include profanity.I fell in love with Javier in On Every Street, and I was ecstatic to know he was getting his own story. This book kept me on the edge of my seat, every emotion was brought out. THE last 15% I didn't take a breath!!!!I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO ALL MY DARK READERS! And lovers of BAD MEN! IT DOESN'T GET ANY BETTER THAN THIS!

recommend_top_items: ["Archer's Voice", 'Seven Sons (Gypsy Brothers) (Volume 1)', 'NaN', 'NaN', 'Interview with a Master', 'Taut: The Ford Book (a Rook and Ronin Spinoff)', "Reaper's Legacy (Reapers Motorcycle Club)", 'Monster in His Eyes', 'Transcendence', "Devil's Game (Reapers Motorcycle Club)"]
reviewText: 5 HOT FOR TEACHER STARS!!!This was AMAZING! Best student/teacher romance I've read."Temptation had come to visit, and her steely determination would likely destroy us both"Addison's character was very original to me, shocking at times. A few times my mouth was wide open! WTH?!?! This girl goes after what she wants, no apologies!!I actually felt bad for Grayson, he tried his hardest to resist temptation."I knew right then after only one taste, that if I couldn't have her, there would be nobody else"AND he bit the apple!!!This story was so unexpected, full of suspense, angst, and extremely H.O.T."I'll teach you how to come with a man inside you""Not a boy, Addison, a man"I will not giveaway the ending or spoil!!You definitely have your own opinion on what will happen, or what happened. My heart was pounding out of my chest for the last 10%. O.M.G.Ella Frank has taking me by surprise again!!!I loved this book!!!"It wasn't good, and it wasn't evil-- it was just love"

reviewText: 4.5 Angst-Filled Stars!EXCEPTIONAL STORY FILLED WITH HEARTBREAK, LOVE, AND HUMOR!!!!This was not what I expected, it was so much more! I absolutely loved some parts, and absolutely hated some parts. Up the rollercoaster, down the rollercoaster I go!! I live for books like this, filled with every emotion imaginable. I wanted to throw my kindle at the wall several times, I wanted to lay down on the floor and throw a tantrum. What the in the HECK is wrong with these people, I say!?!? This is a story about obsession! I was obsessed. I didn't put this book down, I devoured in one sitting.Let's talk ABOUT these characters.Saskia- definitely one of kind, you will want to slap her, hug her, and beg her to seek professional help for her addiction.Jahleel- You are the biggest a**hole on the face of the plant, you gave me whiplash, especially with my emotions. I wanted to hate you but I couldn't. Why couldn't I hate you??This is rocky road but I loved every minute of it!S. Ann Cole has a new fan!Would I recommend? YES! Especially to fans of L.D. Davis, Jamie McGuire, and K.A. Linde.-Wicked Reads Review Team-

title: Bang: Black Lotus #1 (Volume 1)
reviewText: My final rating- 5 Stars for the plot & writing!EXCUSE ME WHILE I VOMIT! I literally feel sick.HOW DO I RATE THIS? This left a bad taste in my mouth, a hole in my chest, and my stomach turning.I love dark books, this one was exceptionally dark... SHOCKING! I have no words. Doom. Sadness. Hopeless. Depressing. I don't know. I just don't know. I didn't love or hate any of the characters. I felt bad for everyone one of them, the circumstances were mind blowing. I was hooked, the story kept me glued to my kindle. The plot was UNIQUE!I need to come back with a clear head!Nope that didn't work. I want to give 3 stars because I had huge problems with the characters. I want to give 5 stars because this book screwed me emotionally. And I CAN'T quit thinking about this crazy book!Nina- I felt bad for you, I truly did. At some point I lost my compassion for you. I felt your revenge was unfounded.Pike- I almost loved you, I do like you. But your flippin' crazy, off your rocker obsessed. Poor guy, you need a shrink.Bennett- I do like you, I wonder if you have something up your sleeve?? Is there anyway for you to get a hea? Probably not, but I could hope for twists in the plot. You were a great husband as far as I could see. Who knows, you could be the better player in this game. I hope you are the good guy.Declan- I'm praying for you, dude. Your dominant ways were kinda of creepy. I'm hoping there's light at the end of your tunnel. It's not looking so good.BANG!

title: Tragic: Rook and Ronin, #1
reviewText: My only problem with this story, it ended, damn it! So, this was a refreshing story, not the same old love song and dance. I like that Rook didn't give up her dreams! She stood her ground, she still needs to overcome her tragic past. Ronin is a bit of a mystery, I think I need more of him. Yeah, I definitely need more of him. I'm going to contradict myself here, I wanted my HEA, not that this didn't end on a good note. Now, here comes the contradiction, I'm happy that the story took a natural pace, both characters didn't fall in love right away and live happily ever after, they are building their relationship on trust.A straight forward, without all the fluffy filler, GREAT BOOK!  I will definitely read the next book in the series!!!

reviewText: ***I received a free copy of this book to read and review for The Wicked Reads Review Team***3.5 - 4 Stars!!!"I woke up in Mercy Hospital in Chicago thirty-six days ago. I spent four days in the hospital portion, and then was sent over to the mental health ward for twenty-nine days. I spent two nights at the federal building and one night with Eli. In that short amount of time, my life has completely changed. I have gone from bring property of a group of mercenaries living a life of pain and anguish to a young women headed to a halfway house, a job, and a future"That's sums up what we know so far. Now we take the journey with Tori to finding herself. I loved watching Tori grow as a person.BUT I WANT MORE ANSWERS. I was left hanging off a cliff. Where's Eli, what does Feds have up their sleeves, Michael, her birth certificate????I was torn on how to rate this book. There were parts I loved, and parts I found to be completely unbelievable. Example- Tori and Enrique's relationship did not feel right, too soon, not enough build-up. I really had to set that aside in my mind so I could focus on the rest of the story.I have to say though, I'm intrigued, I definitely want more, and I will continue this web of crazy. I'll put away the things that bother me, because this story is all consuming!!!!!!

reviewText: 4.5 UNPREDICTABLE STARS!!!WHAT A RIDE! I seriously did not know what would happen next.This woman went through hell and back, then back to hell again. title: Mud Vein
reviewText: 3.5  Sad Stars!Firstly, Tarryn Fisher is a brilliant writer, her storytelling is phenomenal!!!Whoa, where do I start with this book?!?!The self-proclaimed dark junkie is lost for words, I'm stumped, I'm sad, I'm depressed! AND I was blankly staring at the wall after I finished reading.  There's a huge 'statement' being made in this story, but I can't tell you that either. If you're brave enough to venture into this, come back and tell me your thoughts.I think my problem was I was so focused on the words that I missed the meaning. I think a reread is in order.Brilliant Writing!

reviewText: -I received a free copy of this book to read and review for The Wicked Reads Review Team-3.5 Stars!Beautiful!!!I'm being honest by saying this was completely different from anything I've ever read. I rounded up on my rating because this story was truly beautiful and heartfelt, at times I caught myself tearing up. You know when you walk in on a scene and you cover your eyes, just to peek between your fingers? That's how I felt, like I was not supposed to look but nothing could stop me from watching. It was so weird but equally intriguing.Great Job showing the difficulties a transgender person has or will grow through!!!!! It's horrible that people have to hide who they for society.

title: We Are the Goldens
reviewText: *I received a free copy of this book to read and review for The Wicked Reads Review Team*3.5 Stars!OK! UM! I can't explain that much of the story in fear of spoilers. I don't usually read YA, but the cover and the blurb caught my attention! The secret held my attention. Nell is talking to her sister Layla through the whole story, this was quite different for me, I've never read a dialogue like it. There were things that I loved, but some things that bothered me.Let's go with what I loved first. I felt like I was actually reading a teenager's mind, I thought the voice of Nell was spot on for her age!! I'm trying not leave spoilers, so bare with me. The secret is HUGE, and the severity is usually sugarcoated in NA/Erotic books, this was a 'real' look into a taboo subject. It forced me to re-think my perspective on other books which I loved.Just of couple of things bugged me! The ending, I felt unfulfilled and lost. I'm hoping we get another book. Two characters, or should I ghosts plague me. What was the connection with Parker & Duncan? I was intrigued to say the least. But I needed more answers, a better conclusion!!!!I'm definitely glad I gave this book a chance! And I would read more by this author.

title: Rock Bottom (Tristan & Danika) (Volume 2)
reviewText: 4.5 THIS HURT STARS!!!First- I'm a huge fan of RK Lilley's Up in the Air series. I absolutely adore James Cavendish. The whole series is on my favorites shelf. This is completely different, you don't have to read Up In The Air in order to read Tristan & Danika. But you definitely have to read Bad Things, which is the first book of Tristan & Danika's story.Second- I didn't think the first book in this series left me wanting more. And when I heard about this book I was terrified. I read reviews after telling myself not to.I'll be quick.This was an emotional rollercoaster of bad temper and love, Not just love, but the all comsuming sex you have when you are completely in love with someone. The kind of love that is supposed to heal all. But sadly, it never works that way.I CAN'T TELL YOU ANY MORE. You know from reading Bad Things that circumstances aren't ideal with Tristan and Danika.I really broken after reading this...

recommend_top_items: ["Archer's Voice", 'Seven Sons (Gypsy Brothers) (Volume 1)', 'NaN', 'NaN', 'Interview with a Master', 'Taut: The Ford Book (a Rook and Ronin Spinoff)', "Reaper's Legacy (Reapers Motorcycle Club)", 'Monster in His Eyes', 'Transcendence', "Devil's Game (Reapers Motorcycle Club)"]
reviewText: 4 Healing STARS!My first book by Margaret McHeyzer, Thank you, Amy for gifting me a copy!Allyn is a victim of a trully horrific crime. I've read stories of rape before, but not as devastating as this. My stomach is turning as I write this review. If this sorted content is not easy for you to read, move on to another book. With that being said, this story is really about healing!"The monsters under my bed scream at me. They feed my fear. They keep me locked in here, and won't let me move on. But the monsters aren't just under my bed. They're deeply ingrained in my head"Three years after Allyn's attack, Allyn's built herself a cage, so to speak. She never leaves her home in fear her attackers will find her again. I felt her fear, her anxiety, her need to feel safe. It was heart breaking."The world is cruel. People are horrible. I hate people. I hate myself. I can't love anymore. It was beaten out of me."Allyn finally wants to see color in her beige life. She seeks out Dominic; a doctor that's helped others just like her. I loved Dominic from the start. And I loved his point of view. As Dominic helps Allyn heal, he also falls in love with her. I found it quite beautiful."He possesses me, owns me, and his love has led me to a life less broken."No Spoilers here, so the ending threw me for a loop. WOAH! WTF! WTH! NO WAY! ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! You will have to find out for yourself.I felt pure satisfaction.

reviewText: -Novella Three of the Bend Anthology-4.5 Big Bad Wolfe STARS!"Are you cold? he asks. "You're shivering a little.""Omigod, I'm not shivering. I'm trembling. With lust."PLEASE TELL ME THERE'S MORE COMING!Like right now. This was a great start, I really would love to continue this series, I hope there's another full size novel on the way.It's hard for me to rate a novella 5 stars, unless it's connected to a series I'm reading or have read, but I almost found myself rating this 5.Red is B.R.O.K.E. and in desperate need of a job. She reaches out to her grandmother she hasn't ever met. When she reaches the island her grandmother owns, instead of meeting grandma she meets Wolfe aka Race.We do get a little info on Race, but I wanted more. His past is a mystery, I'm intrigued. He never leaves the island... I can't say much more, I don't like to give away the story. I'm digging him though."I'm uncomfortable around people.""It's the closest I can get to the truth, which reads more like I hate everyone."GREAT BEGINNING!

reviewText: 4  RAWR STARS!This was almost a 5 star read for me. Can I say 4 3/4 STARS?Hooked on Twitch is a understatement. O.M.G. title: Twisted Together (Monsters in the Dark) (Volume 3)
reviewText: **I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads Review Team**4 Twisted Stars!!Pepper Winters delivers another dark, twisted, breathtaking story! A great conclusion for Quincy and Tess! All the monsters fed!!!"The blackness tried to swallow us whole, kill us, ruin us, capture our soul"I felt sad at the beginning of the story. Doubt creeped in my mind, reminding me off the darkness Tess has went through. I was worried about their relationship. Can they seek the happiness they both deserve? My heart broke for Q, my heart hurt for Tess!"Intertwined, tangled, knotted forever, our souls will always be twisted together, our demons, our monsters belong to the other, Bow to me, I bow to thee, now we are free"Tess- you are the perfect match for Q, your strength is his strength!"My name is Tess Mercer. I'm no longer weak or afraid or broken"Q- you are the perfect match for Tess, your monsters are her monsters!"If you do, then I'll be the best master and husband the world has ever seen. I'll give you a life full of experiences and passion. We'll finally find peace in the dark"Whew! What a rocky road! I'm so very fulfilled with this ending. Although I could probably read about these monsters everyday!"I'm your monster in the dark forever"

reviewText: *I received a free copy from the author in exchange for a honest review*4 Shocking Stars!"Are you allowed to draw lines in a world with no lines?WOW! BASED ON ACTUAL EVENTS!I have to break this review down. There's two parts in this story. Part One being EXTREMELY DARK, disturbing, shocking, and mind blowing. I was reading with my mouth hanging wide open. This is a captive story, take my warning. If this type of book isn't normally what you read, then stay away! This is by far one of the darkest of the darkest. Lana goes through a tragic event, it's not sugar coated. The captor isn't your average hero that falls in love with his victim and they live happy ever after. This is the real deal!!! This was in third person, normally it's hard for me to connect with characters, not the case here. I felt like Lana's actions/thoughts would be exactly what I would've done.The Second Part wasn't as dark. Quite interesting to say the least. Intriguing, thought provoking and strange at times. I can't say too much without giving the story away. But, what do you do when you think you've turned into the monster? Lana is awakened to a world she knows nothing about, but she needs it, was it always there? Or is she just as depraved as her captor? I'm still trying to wrap my mind around this.THIS STORY WAS EXCEPTIONAL, TOUGH TO READ SOMETIMES, BUT UTTERLY FASCINATING!

reviewText: 5 Nova like the car STARS!!!"Everything... I want to know everything about you, Nova like the car"I loved loved loved this book!!! It's definitely my favorite out of the series so far.It was tough ride to get to the end, but it wouldn't be a Jessica Sorensen story if not.This felt feel, like really real. I could see this story play out in real life, real!!!! If you've dealt with addiction, this was spot on.Jessica has an amazing ability to make everyone of her characters unique. I am in LOVE with Quinton & Nova! Quinton's struggle was hard to read, I felt like my heart was going to beat out of my chest. There were several times I cried, I had to stop reading, re-group and continue. Nova seemed more grown up, more responsible. She was the rock.We also get more information about Delilah.  OMG. I really didn't think... I can't.  My heart broke for Tristan, why? I can't wait to read his story.When Quinton and Nova reunite. FIREWORKS, SPARKS, I got chills up and down my arms, and tears were rolling down my face!!!!I'm getting chills writing this review.This was a rocky road but AMAZING nonetheless.  This is the reason I automatically read Jessica Sorensen and why she continues to be one of my favorite authors.WHAT ELSE CAN I SAY? This was powerful, painful, beautiful, and REAL!!"For everyone who suffered loss and learned how to live again. Know that you're not alone"

reviewText: **I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads Review Team**3 Stars!These small stories seem to be the "it" thing right now. I trully like short reads every once in a while, but at some point I will start feeling like I want more bang for my buck. That's my thoughts on the length of the story. I did get this for free, but if I hadn't I would be disappointed!Angela is married, yet separated from her husband more than she's with him. They both travel constantly. We find this out right away, so I was wondering how this 'One Night' was going play out. I didn't think Angela's character was genuine, I mean seriously?  You just find out you are being betrayed, and you don't shed a single tear. I read fiction everyday, but this was too unbelievable. (I hate using that term) But I couldn't make myself believe this scenario. Don't get me wrong, I liked the whole idea of this story, I just need more out of the characters.I'm hoping the second has more!

title: Desired Affliction 1: Haunted by her Past
reviewText: I received a free copy of this book to read and review for Wicked Reads Review Team*First Half- 4 Stars!Second Half- 3 Stars!3.5 Stars!Lexi is broken. Endless nights of drunken debauchery, the only way she can cope with her tragic past! Kole is your average 'love 'em and leave 'em' type of guy.The first half was painfully realistic. The way Lexi copes with life is spot on. I felt like this was a chapter out of my life. I was emotionally connected to Lexi.The second half was rushed for me. Everything came to an ending pretty quickly. I had whiplash. I needed more between Lexi and Kole. They did have a past which helped, but I still wasn't convinced of their love. I also had to remind myself that these characters were in college, if I hadn't I would be disappointed in their immature behavior.I felt like the author had a great idea, but couldn't find the right ending, it was rushed and glossed over.
